lineage.Process: FeatureClassToFeatureClass K:\projects_public\Justin_Ray\Trout\Trout_Stocked_Streams.shp K:\projects_public\Justin_Ray\Trout\TroutStockedWaters.gdb StockedReaches # "Id 'Id' true true false 6 Long 0 6 ,First,#,K:\projects_public\Justin_Ray\Trout\Trout_Stocked_Streams.shp,Id,-1,-1" # K:\projects_public\Justin_Ray\Trout\TroutStockedWaters.gdb\StockedReaches

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

descript.abstract: This dataset contains the Designated Stocked Trout Waters (Catchable Trout Stocking Program) in Virginia for public use. The stocked trout stream sections are displayed in this dataset. Some special regulation streams displayed do not receive stocking and contain wild trout. These data are formatted as an ArcView shapefile and compiled by the Virginia Department of Game and Inland Fisheries (VDGIF). These data are presented as lines. Rainbow, Brown, and Brook Trout represent the species being stocked. This data does not supercede physical signage at the locations indicated. This data is to be used as a guide, not for official use, and this data is not considered to be an official boundary of the stocked trout waters. Several waterbodies listed here are located on private land. These landowners are allowing the public to fish from their property October 1 through June 15 though an agreement with VDGIF. Misbehavior by anglers could cause a landowner to close their property to public angling.
descript.purpose: To show locations for publicly accessible trout fishing based on VDGIF stocking.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This dataset contains the Designated Stocked Trout Waters (Catchable Trout Stocking Program) in Virginia for public use. The stocked trout stream sections are displayed in this dataset. Some special regulation streams displayed do not receive stocking and contain wild trout. These data are formatted as an ArcView shapefile and compiled by the Virginia Department of Game and Inland Fisheries (VDGIF). These data are presented as lines. Rainbow, Brown, and Brook Trout represent the species being stocked. This data does not supercede physical signage at the locations indicated. This data is to be used as a guide, not for official use, and this data is not considered to be an official boundary of the stocked trout waters. Several waterbodies listed here are located on private land. These landowners are allowing the public to fish from their property October 1 through June 15 though an agreement with VDGIF. Misbehavior by anglers could cause a landowner to close their property to public angling.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Trout stocking designation. Put and Take (PNT), Delayed Harvest (DH), Special Regulations (SR), Feefishing (FF).
County where the majority of the feature is located.
Brook trout stocked. Y = Stocked. M = May be stocked. Null = Not stocked. %s = percent of the total stocked trout.
Rainbow trout stocked. Y = Stocked. M = May be stocked. Null = Not stocked. %s = percent of the total stocked trout.
Brown trout stocked. Y = Stocked. M = May be stocked. Null = Not stocked. %s = percent of the total stocked trout.
Trout stocking category. A = stocked 8 times between October 1 and May 30. B = 5 times. C = 3 times.
Length of the reach in miles
If the reach is a Heritage Day water. http://www.dgif.virginia.gov/fishing/trout/trout-heritage-day/
If the reach is not stocked in the Fall
If the reach lies within a National Forest. National Forest permit required.

overview.dsoverv: This dataset gives spatial representation to the streams listed in the 2011 Virginia Fishing Regulations. Please refer to these regulations for detailed information concerning regulations, stocking information, access, and more. The comments field does not include all of the special regulations which apply to the listed stream reaches.

dataqual.complete: No warranty, expressed or implied, is made regarding the accuracy, adequacy, completeness, reliability, or usefulness of any data provided. These data are provided on an "as is" basis. All warranties of any kind, express or implied, including but not limited to fitness for a particular use, freedom from computer viruses, and non-infringement of proprietary rights, are disclaimed. Data are added and changed periodically, and data may become out-of-date quickly. It is recommended that the user not let a significant period of time elapse between obtaining and using the data. Data was comprised using the most current reports of VDGIF biologists . These listings are subject to frequent and unanounced changes, which may affect stocking status.

procstep.procdesc: The National Hydrography Dataset (1:100,000) was used as the basis for the stream reaches. Start points and end points were GPS coordinates provided by DGIF field biologists. The data was then confirmed by the biologists as accurate, and attribute data was provided by the biologists. The trout stocking regulations from VDGIF were also used to verify attribute accuracy.
procstep.srcused: National Hydrography Dataset. U. S. Geologic Survey. http://nhd.usgs.gov/index.html
